evidence: Its circular motion around the stand is precession.
This motion results from the combination of two effects: the downward force of gravity and the angular momentum around the spinning axis.
Notice how the wheel does not simply fall. Instead, because of torque, it precesses around the point where it is supported.
This is the same principle that applies in MRI. The frequency of precession is directly linked to the strength of the magnetic field.
Stronger forces or fields lead to faster precession.
